schema.title: Response List Models Public Models Get
Response List Voices Public Voices Get
Response List Assets Public Assets Get
Response Generate Asset Public Generations Post

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the model

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of generation the model applies to.

requires_start_frame.title: Requires Start Frame
requires_start_frame.description: Whether the model is conditioned by a start frame.

requires_end_frame.title: Requires End Frame
requires_end_frame.description: Whether the model is conditioned by an end frame.

requires_audio_input.title: Requires Audio Input
requires_audio_input.description: Whether the model is conditioned by audio input.

requires_input_video.title: Requires Input Video
requires_input_video.description: Whether the model requires video input (video-to-video).

requires_character_orientation.title: Requires Character Orientation
requires_character_orientation.description: Whether the model requires character orientation (motion control).

max_duration_ms.title: Max Duration Ms
max_duration_ms.description: Maximum video duration in milliseconds. Only applies to audio-driven models.

custom_resolution.title: Custom Resolution
custom_resolution.description: Whether the model supports custom resolution.

pricing.description: Extensible pricing information with dimension modifiers for resolution, audio, etc.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Width and height for each aspect_ratio and resolution tuple.

logo_url.title: Logo Url
logo_url.description: URL of the model's logo in SVG format.

premium.title: Premium
premium.description: Whether this is a premium model.

display_order.title: Display Order
display_order.description: Display order for UI sorting. Lower values appear first.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the asset.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the asset. Default to user-provided file name.

is_favorite.title: Is Favorite
is_favorite.description: Whether the asset is favorited by the user.

recent.title: Recent
recent.description: Whether this asset was recently used by the user.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the generation created. None if failed.

asset_id.title: Asset Id
asset_id.description: The id of the image asset resulting from the generation. None if failed.

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if this item failed.

BatchImageResultItem.title: BatchImageResultItem
BatchImageResultItem.description: Individual result item in a batch image generation.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the generation created. None if failed.

asset_id.title: Asset Id
asset_id.description: The id of the video asset resulting from the generation. None if failed.

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if this item failed.

BatchVideoResultItem.title: BatchVideoResultItem
BatchVideoResultItem.description: Individual result item in a batch video generation.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the asset. Default to user-provided file name.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the asset. Default to user-provided file name.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the newly created asset. Should be used for upload.

upload_url.title: Upload Url
upload_url.description: Presigned S3 URL for uploading the asset file using HTTP PUT. Only present when the asset type is VIDEO.

expiring.title: Expiring
expiring.description: Credits that will expire in the future.

used.title: Used
used.description: Credits used in the current billing period.

workspace_credits.title: Workspace Credits
workspace_credits.description: Credits for each workspace mapped by workspace_id. Only included if user is in a workspace.

CreditBalance.title: CreditBalance
CreditBalance.description: Information about the current balance of Credits and usage.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id
agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

audio_generation_model_id.title: Audio Generation Model Id
audio_generation_model_id.description: ID of the model to use for video-to-audio generation (Mirelo Studio).

video_id.title: Video Id
video_id.description: The id of the video asset to generate audio from.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Optional prompt to guide the audio generation.

GenerateAudioFromVideoRequest.title: GenerateAudioFromVideoRequest
GenerateAudioFromVideoRequest.description: Audio generation request that extracts sound effects from video using Mirelo Studio.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id
agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

audio_generation_model_id.title: Audio Generation Model Id
audio_generation_model_id.description: ID of the model to use for video-to-audio generation (Mirelo Studio).

video_id.title: Video Id
video_id.description: The id of the video asset to generate audio from.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Optional prompt to guide the audio generation.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the generation created.

asset_id.title: Asset Id
asset_id.description: The id of the audio asset resulting from the generation. Only present when generation is complete.

eta_sec.title: Eta Sec
eta_sec.description: Estimated time until completion in seconds. May be None if no historical data available.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id
agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

text_prompt.title: Text Prompt
text_prompt.description: The text prompt for image generation or image editing.

resolution.title: Resolution
resolution.description: The resolution to use formatted like '540p', '1080p', '1440p (2K QHD)', etc.

start_keyframe_id.title: Start Keyframe Id
start_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the start keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

ai_model_id.title: Ai Model Id
ai_model_id.description: The model to use.

reference_image_ids.title: Reference Image Ids
reference_image_ids.description: The id(s) of the image(s) to reference in the generation. This is only used for image-to-image generation and will supersede start_keyframe_id.

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Number of image variations to generate (1-8). When > 1, batch_results will contain all generation results.

enhance_prompt.title: Enhance Prompt
enhance_prompt.description: If true, automatically enhance the prompt before generation.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id
agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

text_prompt.title: Text Prompt
text_prompt.description: The text prompt for image generation or image editing.

resolution.title: Resolution
resolution.description: The resolution to use formatted like '540p', '1080p', '1440p (2K QHD)', etc.

start_keyframe_id.title: Start Keyframe Id
start_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the start keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

ai_model_id.title: Ai Model Id
ai_model_id.description: The model to use.

reference_image_ids.title: Reference Image Ids
reference_image_ids.description: The id(s) of the image(s) to reference in the generation. This is only used for image-to-image generation and will supersede start_keyframe_id.

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Number of image variations to generate (1-8). When > 1, batch_results will contain all generation results.

enhance_prompt.title: Enhance Prompt
enhance_prompt.description: If true, automatically enhance the prompt before generation.

asset_id.title: Asset Id
asset_id.description: The id of the resulting image asset.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the generation. Can be used to check status.

eta_sec.title: Eta Sec
eta_sec.description: Estimated time until completion in seconds. May be None if no historical data available.

batch_generation_id.title: Batch Generation Id
batch_generation_id.description: Unique identifier linking all generations in a batch.

batch_results.title: Batch Results
batch_results.description: All generation results in the batch. Always populated (even for batch_size=1). The main response fields (id, asset_id, etc.) reflect the first successful generation.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id
agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

ai_model_id.title: Ai Model Id
ai_model_id.description: The model to use for upscaling.

image_id.title: Image Id
image_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the basis for upscaling.

upscale_factor.title: Upscale Factor
upscale_factor.description: Optional upscale factor to pass to the model (e.g. 2.0 for 2x).

generated_video_inputs.description: Video generation parameters including text_prompt and character_orientation.

GenerateMotionControlRequest-Input.title: GenerateMotionControlRequest
GenerateMotionControlRequest-Input.description:
Motion Control request for transferring motion from a reference video to a character image.
Processed through V2V infrastructure internally.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

ai_model_id.title: Ai Model Id
ai_model_id.description: The id of the model to use for sound effect generation.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text description of the sound effect to generate.

duration_seconds.title: Duration Seconds
duration_seconds.description: The duration of the sound effect in seconds (0.5-30). If not specified, duration is automatically determined from the prompt.

prompt_influence.title: Prompt Influence
prompt_influence.description: Controls how strictly the model follows the prompt (0-1). Higher values mean more literal interpretation. Defaults to 0.3.

loop.title: Loop
loop.description: Whether to create a sound effect that loops smoothly. Only available for the eleven_text_to_sound_v2 model.

output_format.title: Output Format
output_format.description: Output format of the generated audio. Formatted as codec_sample_rate_bitrate (e.g., mp3_22050_32, mp3_44100_128, pcm_44100). If not specified, defaults to mp3_44100_128.

prompt_influence.description: Controls how strictly the model follows the prompt (0-1). Higher values mean more literal interpretation. Defaults to 0.3.

loop.title: Loop

output_format.title: Output Format
output_format.description: Output format of the generated audio. Formatted as codec_sample_rate_bitrate (e.g., mp3_22050_32, mp3_44100_128, pcm_44100). If not specified, defaults to mp3_44100_128.

id.description: The id of the generation created.

eta_sec.title: Eta Sec
eta_sec.description: Estimated time until completion in seconds. May be None if no historical data available.

agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

voice_id.title: Voice Id
voice_id.description: The id of the Voice to use.

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: The id of the model to use.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text to convert to speech.

stability.title: Stability
stability.description: Stability should be between 0-1, where 0 is the most stable and 1 is the most unstable. This varies the consistency between your outputs.

speed.title: Speed
speed.description: Speed should be between 0.7 and 1.2, where 0.7 is the slowest and 1.2 is the fastest. This varies the speed of the generated speech.

language.description: Language for TTS. See SupportedLanguage enum for valid values. Defaults to 'auto'.

id.description: The id of the generation created.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

ai_model_id.title: Ai Model Id
ai_model_id.description: ID of the model to use for the generation.

start_keyframe_id.title: Start Keyframe Id
start_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the start keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

start_keyframe_url.title: Start Keyframe Url
start_keyframe_url.description: The URL of the image to use as the start keyframe.

end_keyframe_id.title: End Keyframe Id
end_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the end keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

end_keyframe_url.title: End Keyframe Url
end_keyframe_url.description: The URL of the image to use as the end keyframe.

audio_id.title: Audio Id
audio_id.description: The id of the Audio asset to use.

audio_generation.description: Optional TTS parameters for server-side audio generation. If provided (and audio_id is not), audio will be generated from these params before video generation.

audio_start_ms.title: Audio Start Ms
audio_start_ms.description: Audio start offset in milliseconds. Negative values prepend silence (e.g., -1000 adds 1s silence before audio). Positive values crop from the beginning of the source audio (e.g., 2000 skips the first 2s). Use with generated_video_inputs.duration_ms to control total output length.

reference_image_ids.title: Reference Image Ids
reference_image_ids.description: The id(s) of the image(s) to reference in the generation. Only used for multi-image video generation and will supersede start_keyframe_id.

video_id.title: Video Id
video_id.description: The id of the Video asset to use as motion input for V2V (motion control) models.

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Number of video variations to generate (1-8). When > 1, batch_results will contain all generation results.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id
agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

ai_model_id.title: Ai Model Id
ai_model_id.description: ID of the model to use for the generation.

start_keyframe_id.title: Start Keyframe Id
start_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the start keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

start_keyframe_url.title: Start Keyframe Url
start_keyframe_url.description: The URL of the image to use as the start keyframe.

end_keyframe_id.title: End Keyframe Id
end_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the end keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

end_keyframe_url.title: End Keyframe Url
end_keyframe_url.description: The URL of the image to use as the end keyframe.

audio_id.title: Audio Id
audio_id.description: The id of the Audio asset to use.

audio_generation.description: Optional TTS parameters for server-side audio generation. If provided (and audio_id is not), audio will be generated from these params before video generation.

audio_start_ms.title: Audio Start Ms
audio_start_ms.description: Audio start offset in milliseconds. Negative values prepend silence (e.g., -1000 adds 1s silence before audio). Positive values crop from the beginning of the source audio (e.g., 2000 skips the first 2s). Use with generated_video_inputs.duration_ms to control total output length.

reference_image_ids.title: Reference Image Ids
reference_image_ids.description: The id(s) of the image(s) to reference in the generation. Only used for multi-image video generation and will supersede start_keyframe_id.

video_id.title: Video Id
video_id.description: The id of the Video asset to use as motion input for V2V (motion control) models.

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Number of video variations to generate (1-8). When > 1, batch_results will contain all generation results.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id
agent_thread_id.description: Optional agent thread ID to associate this generation with.

generation_id.title: Generation Id
generation_id.description: Optional pre-reserved generation ID. If provided, this ID will be used instead of generating a new one. For batch operations (batch_size > 1), use generation_ids instead.

generation_ids.title: Generation Ids
generation_ids.description: Optional list of pre-reserved generation IDs for batch operations. Length must match batch_size. Mutually exclusive with generation_id.

ai_model_id.title: Ai Model Id
ai_model_id.description: ID of the model to use for the generation.

start_keyframe_id.title: Start Keyframe Id
start_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the start keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

start_keyframe_url.title: Start Keyframe Url
start_keyframe_url.description: The URL of the image to use as the start keyframe.

end_keyframe_id.title: End Keyframe Id
end_keyframe_id.description: The id of the Image asset to use as the end keyframe. This will be ignored if reference_image_ids is provided.

end_keyframe_url.title: End Keyframe Url
end_keyframe_url.description: The URL of the image to use as the end keyframe.

audio_id.title: Audio Id
audio_id.description: The id of the Audio asset to use.

audio_generation.description: Optional TTS parameters for server-side audio generation. If provided (and audio_id is not), audio will be generated from these params before video generation.

audio_start_ms.title: Audio Start Ms
audio_start_ms.description: Audio start offset in milliseconds. Negative values prepend silence (e.g., -1000 adds 1s silence before audio). Positive values crop from the beginning of the source audio (e.g., 2000 skips the first 2s). Use with generated_video_inputs.duration_ms to control total output length.

reference_image_ids.title: Reference Image Ids
reference_image_ids.description: The id(s) of the image(s) to reference in the generation. Only used for multi-image video generation and will supersede start_keyframe_id.

video_id.title: Video Id
video_id.description: The id of the Video asset to use as motion input for V2V (motion control) models.

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Number of video variations to generate (1-8). When > 1, batch_results will contain all generation results.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the generation created.

asset_id.title: Asset Id
asset_id.description: The id of the video asset resulting from the generation.

eta_sec.title: Eta Sec
eta_sec.description: Estimated time until completion in seconds. May be None if no historical data available.

batch_generation_id.title: Batch Generation Id
batch_generation_id.description: Unique identifier linking all generations in a batch.

batch_results.title: Batch Results
batch_results.description: All generation results in the batch. Always populated (even for batch_size=1). The main response fields (id, asset_id, etc.) reflect the first successful generation.

agent_thread_id.title: Agent Thread Id

ai_model_id.description: The id of the model to use for video-to-video generation.

video_id.title: Video Id
video_id.description: The id of the video asset to transform.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Natural language transformation instructions. Use @Element1, @Image1 syntax to reference elements and images.

reference_image_asset_ids.title: Reference Image Asset Ids
reference_image_asset_ids.description: Optional ids of reference image assets for style transfer. Reference as @Image1, @Image2, etc. in prompt.

elements.title: Elements
elements.description: Optional elements for character tracking. Reference as @Element1, @Element2, etc. in prompt.

keep_audio.title: Keep Audio
keep_audio.description: Whether to preserve the original audio from the input video.

bounding_box_target.description: Normalized coordinates for primary speaker position (Character3 only)

character_orientation.title: Character Orientation
character_orientation.description: For motion control models: 'video' matches reference video orientation (better for complex motions, max 30s), 'image' preserves character image orientation (better for camera movements, max 10s).

enhance_prompt.title: Enhance Prompt
enhance_prompt.description: If true, automatically enhance the prompt before generation.

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the generation and associated asset.

eta_sec.title: Eta Sec
eta_sec.description: Estimated time remaining in seconds until generation completes.

batch_generation_id.title: Batch Generation Id
batch_generation_id.description: Unique identifier linking all generations in a batch.

asset.description: The generated asset. Value is not present unless the status of the generation is 'complete'

error.description: Generation error if any. Value is not present unless the status of the generation is 'error' and error_message field is not present.

error_message.title: Error Message
error_message.description: Error message. Value is not present unless the status of the generation is 'error' and error field is not present.

GenerationErrorType.title: GenerationErrorType
GenerationErrorType.description:
Generation error type

NOTE: The backend will try to map any error happening during generation to one of these classes.
    If it fails to do so it will map onto UNKNOWN.

NOTE: The semantic meaning of these errors types is roughly mapped from the semantic of the gRPC
    status codes: see https://grpc.io/docs/guides/status-codes/ for details. Not all the gGRPC
    status codes are mapped here (not needed at the moment).

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the generation.

error_message.title: Error Message
error_message.description: Error message. Value is not present unless the status of the generation is 'error'

workspace_id.title: Workspace Id
workspace_id.description: ID of the workspace this generation belongs to.

GenerationType.title: GenerationType
GenerationType.description:
Generation type enum

NOTE: this enum is used to determine the type of generation and is used to determine
the type of asset that will be generated.

frontal_image_asset_id.title: Frontal Image Asset Id
frontal_image_asset_id.description: ID of the frontal image asset for this element.

reference_image_asset_ids.title: Reference Image Asset Ids
reference_image_asset_ids.description: Optional IDs of additional reference image assets (different angles).

KlingO1EditElement.title: KlingO1EditElement
KlingO1EditElement.description:
Element for character tracking in Kling O1 Edit.

Reference as @Element1, @Element2, etc. in prompt.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Number of items returned in the page.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Number of items returned in the page.

base_cost.title: Base Cost
base_cost.description: Flat base cost in credits. Present for per-generation models (images). Duration-based models leave this unset.

credits_per_second.title: Credits Per Second
credits_per_second.description: Credit cost per second. Only present for duration-based models. Image/per-generation models leave this unset.

additionalProperties.description:
Pricing modifier multiplier applied to a dimension option.
- 1.0 = no change (base price)
- 2.0 = double the base price
- 0.5 = half the base price

modifiers.title: Modifiers
modifiers.description: Pricing modifiers by dimension. Each dimension (e.g. 'resolution', 'generate_audio') maps option values to their price multipliers. Only non-1.0 modifiers are included (1.0 is the implicit default). Example: {'resolution': {'540p': 0.5, '1080p': 3.0}}

Pricing.title: Pricing
Pricing.description:
Extensible pricing information for AI models.

Price is calculated as:
    credits = ceil((base_cost + credits_per_second * duration_seconds) * product(modifiers))

For video models (per-second billing):
    - base_cost is typically 0
    - credits_per_second is the per-second rate
    - duration_seconds is the video length
    - modifiers adjust for resolution, audio generation, etc.

For image models (per-generation billing):
    - base_cost is the flat cost per generation (e.g., 5 credits)
    - credits_per_second is 0
    - duration_seconds is ignored (or 0)
    - modifiers can still adjust for resolution, style, etc.

Modifiers are only included when they affect pricing (i.e., non-1.0 values).

duration_ms.title: Duration Ms
duration_ms.description: Duration of the audio in seconds.

duration_ms.title: Duration Ms
duration_ms.description: Duration of the video in milliseconds.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Labels that help identify the characteristics of the Voice.
